summary: This document contains profiles and biographical information about Jeffrey E. Epstein, detailing his career, affiliations, and net worth. It highlights his roles in various organizations and his financial background, including his connections to notable individuals and institutions.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey E. Epstein is presented as a prominent financier and philanthropist with a significant net worth, known for his educational and scientific contributions.

persons.name: Leslie Wexner
persons.context: Leslie Wexner is mentioned as one of Epstein's biggest clients, known for his role as the founder of the Limited chain of women's clothing stores.

connections.description: Leslie Wexner is noted as a significant client of Jeffrey Epstein's financial firm.

keyFacts: Jeffrey E. Epstein has an estimated net worth of $2 billion.
He was born on January 20, 1953, in Brooklyn, New York.
Epstein began his career at Bear Stearns in 1976 and later founded his own financial firm, J. Epstein & Co.
He is known for funding The Program for Evolutionary Dynamics at Harvard University.
Leslie Wexner is identified as one of Epstein's most notable clients.
